Aid ship for Gaza expected to depart Cyprus this weekendBy Yiannis Kourtoglou and Stamos Prousalis Sat, 09 Mar 2024 14:29:49 GMT TGXTU33UVZMM3CZEONG7ZL324E https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/aid-ship-gaza-expected-depart-cyprus-this-weekend-2024-03-09/Reuters世界中东
Pakistan's former President Zardari wins another termPakistan's former President Asif Ali Zardari won a second term on Saturday, supported by the ruling coalition in a vote by parliament and regional assemblies, the election presiding officer said. Sat, 09 Mar 2024 13:46:23 GMT YSIBJWXZXROWNHGOMJTC6EEJ5E https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/pakistans-former-president-zardari-wins-another-term-2024-03-09/Asif Shahzad世界亚太地区
Ireland looks set to reject constitutional changesIreland looked set to reject proposals to replace constitutional references to the makeup of a family and women's "life within the home" when votes are counted on Saturday, in what would be a significant defeat for the government. Sat, 09 Mar 2024 13:39:55 GMT 2LWA4VN5UNICLMXJDOU64VSFPI https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ireland-looks-set-reject-constitutional-changes-2024-03-09/Reuters世界欧洲
Pope accepts resignation of Polish bishop for negligence over abusePope Francis has accepted the resignation of a Polish bishop for negligence in handling cases of sexual abuse committed by some clergy against minors, his representatives in the country said on Saturday. Sat, 09 Mar 2024 13:14:07 GMT 7MZ42W5LVVKF7AUW2WMYAHYZUY https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/pope-accepts-resignation-polish-bishop-negligence-over-abuse-2024-03-09/Reuters世界欧洲
Thousands march in Madrid to protest against Catalan amnesty lawThousands of Spaniards marched through the centre of Madrid on Saturday to protest against an amnesty bill for Catalan separatists involved in a failed 2017 independence bid. Israel strikes landmark residential tower in southern Rafah as truce talks stallIsrael struck one of the largest residential towers in Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip on Saturday, residents said, stepping up pressure on the last area of the enclave it has not yet invaded and where over a million displaced Palestinians are sheltering. Armenia is considering seeking EU membership, foreign minister saysArmenia is considering applying for European Union membership, foreign minister Ararat Mirzoyan said on Friday, as it seeks to forge closer ties with the West in the face of tensions with traditional ally Russia. Greek parliament approves private foreign universities, bucking protestsGreece’s parliament narrowly passed a bill early on Saturday that will allow foreign private universities to set up branches in the country, bucking weeks of protests by students who say the move will devalue degrees from public universities. Sat, 09 Mar 2024 08:49:40 GMT NCTWBZSQNFLKVIO55YOWP24KWQ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/greek-parliament-approves-private-foreign-universities-bucking-protests-2024-03-09/Reuters世界欧洲
Houthis target bulk carrier, US destroyers in Red SeaAmerican and French forces downed dozens of drones in the Red Sea on Saturday after Yemen's Iran-aligned Houthis targeted bulk carrier Propel Fortune and U.S. destroyers in the Gulf of Aden. Hungary's PM Orban supports Trump after Florida meetingHungary's right-wing nationalist Prime Minister Viktor Orban lent his support to his long-time ally Donald Trump's bid to return to White House after meeting the former U.S. president in Florida late on Friday.
